blocks.text: Nation-state actors are government-backed groups that conduct cyber operations to advance national interests such as intelligence gathering, military advantage, and economic competitiveness.
These groups typically have substantial funding, access to advanced tools, and long-term operational goals. They may remain undetected for extended periods.
Targets often include government agencies, defense contractors, energy providers, and critical infrastructure.
Because attribution is difficult, nation-state campaigns frequently use proxy infrastructure and compromised systems to hide their origin.
